person.persName: James R. Hallam (Kenton Co/Campbell Co Lawyer)

body.p: Newport, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Virginia native. Married to Clain M. Hallam. Father of Henry C. Hallam, Theodore Hallam, James R. Hallam, Jr., Orrin Hallam, and Frank Hallam. Delegate from Grant County to the Whig Party Convention of Kentucky in 1852. Appointed assistant elector for the presidential election of 1852 in Kentucky's tenth congressional district. Attorney in Newport, Kentucky in 1860. Commonwealth Attorney pro temp in 1864-1865 for the Kenton Circuit Court.
